keep off.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to prevent something from touching or harming something
keep off.translation[0].definitions[0].e: She held an old piece of cloth over them both to keep the rain off.
How are we going to keep the flies off this food?
keep off.translation[0].definitions[1].d: used to tell someone not to touch someone or something
keep off.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to not eat, drink, or take something that is bad for you, or to stop someone else from eating, drinking, or taking it
keep off.translation[0].definitions[2].e: a programme aimed at keeping teenagers off drugs
keep off.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to avoid talking about a particular subject, especially so that you do not upset someone
keep off.translation[0].definitions[4].d: if you keep weight off, you do not get heavier again after you have lost weight
keep off.translation[0].definitions[5].d: if rain keeps off, it does not fall
